page.title: 10FINE SHEEPSKIN FACTORY.
page.content: OVER A 100 YEARS AGO IN THE HEART OF THE COUNTRYSIDE JON WOOD SET UP THE FIRM THAT STILL BEARS HIS NAME.BUSINESS WAS CONTINUED TO THOSE ENDS UP TO 1920. FELLMONGERING IS THE PROCESS OF SEPARATING THE WOOL FROM THE SKIN BY A SIMPLE CHEMICAL PROCESS, SELLING THE WOOL TO MERCHANTS AND MAKING LEATHER WITH THE REST.IT WAS HIS GRANDSON ANOTHER JON WOOD, WHO DECIDED THAT A COMPLETE SHEEPSKIN IS MORE VALUABLE THAN IT IS COMPONENT PARTS AND BEGAN TO DRESS THE PELTS IN THERE ORIGINAL STATE. HIS METHODS WERE SIMPLE AND TRADITIONAL,ALUM AND SALT TANNAGE, HARD WORK A CRAFTMAN'S SKILL. TODAY THE TANNAGE HAS CHANGED TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE AND THE LATEST CHEMICAL AND ADVICE PRODUCE A SKIN THAT IS STRONGER, WASHABLE, AND MORE BEAUTIFUL,BUT THE CRAFTMANS SHIP
